title: How do book publishers pay authors? - Quora

response.answer_text: With money. Usually either a check, or these days some kind of direct deposit (particularly small presses). Some publishers give advances, some don’t. Pretty much all legitimate presses pay royalties (occasionally work might be acquired for a flat fee). It goes without saying that they pay you, not the other way around.
Generally from the author’s book sales. After all the costs of printing, marketing distribution etc, the author gets his fee.
